metadata.title: CVE-2021-21845 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: Multiple exploitable integer overflow vulnerabilities exist within the MPEG-4 decoding functionality of the GPAC Project on Advanced Content library v1.0.1. A specially crafted MPEG-4 input in “stsc” decoder can cause an integer overflow due to unchecked arithmetic resulting in a heap-based buffer overflow that causes memory corruption. An attacker can convince a user to open a video to trigger this vulnerability.

criterions.comment: gpac package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
